intro: Palicourea decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive palicourea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments. Its name "decipiens" refers to its deceptive appearance, as it can resemble other plants in its habitat.
